seo.description: Updated guide on NDPS Act Section 52A inventory, sampling rules, and why violations lead to bail in recent Supreme Court trends.

articles.content:
Overview of Section 52A NDPS Act

Section 52A requires detailed inventory of seized narcotics and sampling in magistrate presence to ensure chain of custody integrity.

Key Mandatory Steps

  • Post-seizure inventory preparation
  • Magistrate oversight for sampling
  • Proper sealing and labelling
  • Unbroken chain of custody documentation

2025–2026 Judicial Trends

Supreme Court and High Courts repeatedly grant bail/acquittal for procedural lapses under Section 52A. Recent rulings emphasize strict compliance in light of BNSS evidence rules.

articles.content:
Who Qualifies for Maintenance?

Wives (including divorced) and minor children can claim under Section 125 CrPC (now BNSS provisions).

Quantum Determination Factors

  • Husband's income & assets
  • Family lifestyle standard
  • Needs of claimant and dependents
  • Separate income of wife (if any)

Key 2025 Supreme Court Updates

Rajnesh v. Neha guidelines reinforced in 2025 cases; courts emphasize fair, non-punitive amounts. Recent rulings balance rights with misuse prevention.
